text.sentence: Technology | U.S. Software twenty five February two thousand sixteen
Solid results: Salesforce reported healthy results with essentially every metric ahead of expectations, and FY seventeen guidance was also raised slightly.
The company beat consensus billings estimates by roughly six percent, while revenue, adjusted operating margin and EPS were also at least in line to slightly better than expected.
If we were to nitpick, the implied Qone billings guidance could have been better, tough we believe this will be largely overlooked by investors given the encouraging performance overall.

Balanced growth across products and geographies: We believe that one of the most notable aspects of the company's recent performance has been the healthy growth achieved across multiple clouds and the reacceleration of the sales cloud was particularly impressive this quarter, in our view.

The performance by region was also healthy overall with growth in the Americas in line with the growth achieved last quarter at twenty seven percent y/y in constant currency, while Asia Pacific and Europe both accelerated to twenty six percent and thirty two percent, respectively.

Leverage starting to come through: We have continued to see leverage achieved in the financial model, and generally expect this trend to continue going forward; however, the implied margin expansion of one hundred twenty five one hundred fiftybps assumed in management's FY seventeen outlook was slightly below what we and investors had been hoping for, specifically as Salesforce delivered ~one hundred eightybps of expansion in FYsixteen.
Nevertheless, we believe the potential for continued margin expansion and outsized cash flow growth keep the investment thesis compelling relative to peers, in our view.

Reiterate OW Rating: We believe the company has ample runway to sustain its high growth trajectory given its combination of clouds that it continues to enhance through organic and inorganic innovation, which the company should also be able to augment with considerable improvement on the bottom line over the near to medium term.
We reiterate our OW rating and raise our price target to dollar seventy two.

We like the large scale of the Sales Force Automation business and expect strong growth there to continue.
We also like the move into other application markets such as with Customer Service and Marketing clouds.
The new areas Salesforce has expanded into such as Marketing and Salesforceone for Mobile, as well as greater enterprise and industry focus, could drive more growth than we currently expect.
The new growth initiatives around enterprise strategy and move to new market areas may not pay off, which will lead to a growth slowdown but still relatively high costs.

Salesforce reported quarterly results that exceeded consensus across most key metrics while guidance was also roughly in line to slightly ahead of expectations.
Given the recent pullback in the shares, as well as the general nervousness in the broader equity markets, we think the shares should react positively over the coming days.
hundred fifty four billion came in well ahead of consensus of dollar three.seventy billion, driven by revenue of dollar one.eight
hundred ninety three billion, and deferred revenue of dollar four.two hundred ninety two billion vs. consensus of dollar four.one hundred twenty billion.
Growth by product line was generally balanced, with sales cloud revenue up twelve.three
Profitability was also in line to slightly ahead of expectations with adjusted operating margin and adjusted EPS of twelve.one
For a complete summary of results versus Barclays and consensus estimates, please refer to the table below.

Salesforce issued guidance that exceeded consensus estimates both for the quarter and for the full year; however, the company's deferred revenue guidance implied billings growth of mid teens which was a bit surprising.

Additionally, the implied margin improvement was towards the lower end of the previously suggested range, although this may be due to a decent dose of conservatism on the behalf of the management team.
Revenue guidance for the quarter came in at dollar one.eight
hundred sixty billion, and full year revenue guidance is in the range of dollar eight.eighty
hundred twenty billion, just slightly ahead of street expectations of dollar eight.eighty
was also just ahead of full year consensus of dollar .ninety
For a summary of management's guidance versus consensus please refer to the below table.
dollar,mn Guidance Qone seventeen Revenue EPS, non GAAP one thousand eight hundred eighty five ­ one thousand eight hundred ninety five .twenty
percent Guidance FY seventeen eight thousand eighty ­ eight thousand one hundred twenty .ninety
Deferred revenue came in at dollar four.two hundred ninety two billion, was better than consensus .
hundred fifty four billion well ahead of consensus of dollar three.seventy billion.
As in past quarters the company's reported billings number had a few items that in our view have to be adjusted to get a more accurate view performance in the quarter.

Specifically, management commented that the FX headwind on revenue and total deferred revenue was dollar thirty two million and dollar forty eight million, respectively, while the tailwind to deferred revenue growth y/y from the increase in annual billings was roughly three percent, or dollar one hundred million by our estimate.
Given the aforementioned adjustments, we believe that adjusted billings growth was closer to twenty seven percent y/y.

Nevertheless, we think investors generally believe management FY seventeen guidance is relatively conservative and supportive of beat and raise quarters going forward as backlog remains solid with Qfour coming in at dollar seven.ten billion and total deferred revenue plus backlog ending at dollar eleven.three
We think one of the most impressive aspects of the company's performance recently has been the balanced growth across multiple clouds.
As shown in the figure below, revenue growth accelerated across most clouds this quarter, which we view as encouraging considering many of these clouds are reaching scale.
Specifically, growth accelerated in sales, marketing and platform, and was partially offset by a modest tick down in service cloud growth.
Nevertheless, we believe the longer term opportunity around the service cloud remains meaningful, followed closely by the opportunities around the marketing and platform use cases.
Given the scale achieved, we believe investors are closely tracking profitability trends at Salesforce.

As shown in the figure below, there has been a clear inflection in adjusted operating margin over the past few years, although as noted above, the FY seventeen margin expansion of one hundred twenty five to one hundred fiftybps implied by management's outlook was slightly below what investors had been hoping for.
Nonetheless, we believe the potential for margin expansion and outsized cash flow growth makes the Salesforce invest thesis compelling relative to comparable growth peers.
We are revising our model based on management's guidance and commentary around current business conditions.
Specifically, our FY seventeen revenue estimate moves from dollar eight.six billion to dollar eight.one
hundred ten billion and our FYeighteen revenue estimate moves from dollar nine.four hundred eighty nine billion to dollar nine.six hundred twenty four billion.
This drives an increase to our price target from dollar sixty seven to dollar seventy two, based on EV/sales of five.fivex, using CY seventeen sales of approximately dollar nine.five billion.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .

Valuation Methodology: Our dollar seventy two price target is based on a calendar CY seventeen EV/Sales multiple of five.fivex and a revenue estimate of approximately dollar nine.fivebn.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: Saleforce competes in the highly competitive enterprise software market, and larger entrants such as Microsoft, SAP, and Oracle could undermine pricing support over time, making it difficult for Salesforce to achieve its financial objectives.
As a high growth company carrying a relatively high valuation, shares are susceptible to significant multiple pressure during market selloffs.
